Package ohos.media.sessioncore

Class AVController

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.media.sessioncore.AVController

  • public final class AVController
extends Object
    Allows your application to interact with media sessions to control media playback, for example, to start or stop playback, or play the next media item. You can register a callback to receive changes, for example, of metadata and playback states from a media session.
    Since:
    3
    See Also:
    AVSession
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Multimedia#MEDIA

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      class  AVController.PlayControls
      An inner class of AVController to send media playback requests to the AVSession and allow your application to send commands to the media session.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      AVController​(Context context, AVToken avToken)
      A constructor used to create an AVController instance for your application to control media playback.

      Obtains the IntentAgent instance for starting the user interface.

      Obtains additional information about the media session.

      Obtains the token for your application to connect to the AVSession instance.

      Obtains additional data of the AVSession instance connected to this AVController.

      Obtains the application bundle name in the AVSession instance.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AVController

        public AVController​(Context context,
                    AVToken avToken)
        A constructor used to create an AVController instance for your application to control media playback.
        Parameters:
        context - Indicates the application context.
        avToken - Indicates the media session token.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the application context or token is null.
        Since:
        3

    • Method Detail

      • setControllerForAbility

        public static boolean setControllerForAbility​(Ability ability,
                                              AVController controller)
        Registers this AVController with an Ability to receive a key event.
        Parameters:
        ability - Indicates the ability to register the controller with.
        controller - Indicates the AVController instance to register.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the registration is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • setAVControllerCallback

        public boolean setAVControllerCallback​(AVControllerCallback callback)
        Registers a callback to receive changes, for example, of metadata and playback states from a media session.
        Parameters:
        callback - Indicates the callback to implement for your application. For available callbacks, see AVControllerCallback.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the registration is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • releaseAVControllerCallback

        public boolean releaseAVControllerCallback​(AVControllerCallback callback)
        Releases the callback set for the AVSession instance.
        Parameters:
        callback - Indicates the callback to implement for your application. For available callbacks, see AVControllerCallback.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the callback is released; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • dispatchAVKeyEvent

        public boolean dispatchAVKeyEvent​(KeyEvent keyEvent)
        Dispatches a key event to the media session for the application to control playback.
        Parameters:
        keyEvent - Indicates the key event.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the dispatch is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:

      • sendCustomCommand

        public void sendCustomCommand​(String command,
                              PacMap pacMap,
                              GeneralReceiver receiverCb)
        Sends a custom command from the application to the media session.

        You can refer to AVSessionCallback.onCommand(java.lang.String, ohos.utils.PacMap, ohos.app.GeneralReceiver) to specify the input parameters.

        Parameters:
        command - Indicates the command.
        pacMap - Indicates command parameters, which can be null.
        receiverCb - Indicates the callback that receives the execution result. This parameter can be null.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the command is null.
        Since:
        3

      • getAVSessionAbility

        public IntentAgent getAVSessionAbility​()
        Obtains the IntentAgent instance for starting the user interface.
        Returns:
        Returns the IntentAgent instance.
        Since:
        3

      • getAVToken

        public AVToken getAVToken​()
        Obtains the token for your application to connect to the AVSession instance. This token is used to create an AVController instance.
        Returns:
        Returns the token.

      • adjustAVPlaybackVolume

        public void adjustAVPlaybackVolume​(int direction,
                                   int flags)
        Adjusts relative volume for the playback. The adjustment direction must be one of the following:
        • Increase: -1
        • Decrease: 1
        • Remain: 0
        Parameters:
        direction - Indicates the adjustment direction.
        flags - Indicates flags for additional information.
        Since:
        3

      • setAVPlaybackVolume

        public void setAVPlaybackVolume​(int value,
                                int flags)
        Sets absolute volume for the playback.
        Parameters:
        value - Indicates the playback volume to set to.
        flags - Indicates flags for additional information.
        Since:
        3
